text:
- My team is in charge
of our cloud platform.
We're a multi-cloud company.
We were trying to solve a problem
in our observability space.
Back in 2022, we came up with an idea
of what if we had a single view?

What if everybody did observability
monitoring the same way?
And we wanted to bring that into one place

so everybody could view
metrics, view traces,
and view their events

in the same way across
the entire environment.

We built a platform using
AWS Managed Prometheus,
where we had the capability
to grab metrics across all our compute,
which is Windows, Linux servers,
on AWS, Azure, on-prem, BMC Cloud,
bring that all into one environment,

and letting Prometheus
gather all that data,
and using Managed Grafana

to be able to view all
that data in one dashboard.
Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus
is what we're using today

to gather all our data from
all our other monitoring tools
and metrics from servers, Windows,
and everything into one place,

and it gave us the ability
to not only make our changes
in the views that we wanted,

but also where we didn't
have to manage it.
It was an easy button for us.
It would just work.
What that meant for us in the end
is that it got us up quicker

than if we had managed
the service ourselves,

and it gave us the ability to
focus on the business needs,

adding the monitors to focus
on the business solutions.
(upbeat music)
(upbeat music fades)
